result.markdown:
# Boosted gradient trees






Boosted gradient machines achieve currently state-of-the-art performance for structured (tabular) data which makes them probably one of the most important algorithms for E&E where structured data dominates the field.

In the following, we use the 'xgboost' package (@xgboost) (Python: 'xgboost' (@xgboost), Julia: 'MLJ' (@anthony_blaom_2019_3541506))

## Classification

::: panel-tabset
### R


::: {.cell hash='brt_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-2_ea02bba1c35aa23d56cd4eeaa62c88eb'}

```{.r .cell-code}
library(xgboost)
X = as.matrix(iris[,1:4])
Y = as.integer(iris[,5]) - 1 # classes must be integers starting from 0

xgdata = xgb.DMatrix(X, label = Y)

# nrounds = number of trees in the ensemble
brt = xgboost(data = xgdata, 
              objective="multi:softprob", 
              nrounds = 50, 
              num_class = 3,
              verbose = 0)
```
:::


Show feature importances:


::: {.cell hash='brt_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-3_83374468ad0befa2a0f02779fa61fc87'}

```{.r .cell-code}
xgb.importance(model = brt)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
        Feature        Gain      Cover Frequency
1: Petal.Length 0.671879438 0.57441039 0.3792049
2:  Petal.Width 0.311535837 0.29261084 0.3088685
3:  Sepal.Width 0.010177107 0.04910115 0.1162080
4: Sepal.Length 0.006407618 0.08387763 0.1957187
```
:::
:::


Make predictions (class probabilities):


::: {.cell hash='brt_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-4_e0449f4cdad7a5b56e3c1149c6a63d92'}

```{.r .cell-code}
head(matrix(predict(brt, newdata = xgb.DMatrix(X)), ncol =3), n = 3)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
            [,1]        [,2]        [,3]
[1,] 0.995287061 0.002195822 0.001027058
[2,] 0.003323558 0.995396435 0.001592265
[3,] 0.001389398 0.002407764 0.997380674
```
:::
:::


### Python


::: {.cell hash='brt_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-5_4b12e27c7ecbb8437489686c8e301e28'}

```{.python .cell-code}
import xgboost as xgb
from sklearn import datasets
from sklearn.preprocessing import scale
iris = datasets.load_iris()
X = scale(iris.data)
Y = iris.target

# Parameters:
param = {
  'max_depth':2, 
  'eta':1, 
  'objective':'multi:softmax' }
num_round = 50

model = xgb.XGBClassifier(param, num_round, verbosity = 0).fit(X, Y)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
/home/max/miniconda3/envs/r-sjsdm/lib/python3.9/site-packages/xgboost/core.py:568: FutureWarning: Pass `objective, use_label_encoder` as keyword args.  Passing these as positional arguments will be considered as error in future releases.
  warnings.warn(
```
:::
:::


Feature importance


::: {.cell hash='brt_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-6_ade93e46637bee6f65dd689693440245'}

```{.python .cell-code}
model.feature_importances_
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
array([0.00959796, 0.01645038, 0.6765859 , 0.29736578], dtype=float32)
```
:::
:::


Make predictions:


::: {.cell hash='brt_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-7_1770c32e3c5eb9a369068e41f8e4f0fb'}

```{.python .cell-code}
model.predict_proba(X)[0:10,:]
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
array([[9.9680281e-01, 2.3831066e-03, 8.1413286e-04],
       [9.9636227e-01, 2.3820533e-03, 1.2557388e-03],
       [9.9680281e-01, 2.3831066e-03, 8.1413286e-04],
       [9.9679452e-01, 2.3830866e-03, 8.2237815e-04],
       [9.9680281e-01, 2.3831066e-03, 8.1413286e-04],
       [9.9680281e-01, 2.3831066e-03, 8.1413286e-04],
       [9.9680281e-01, 2.3831066e-03, 8.1413286e-04],
       [9.9680281e-01, 2.3831066e-03, 8.1413286e-04],
       [9.9636227e-01, 2.3820533e-03, 1.2557388e-03],
       [9.9679452e-01, 2.3830866e-03, 8.2237815e-04]], dtype=float32)
```
:::
:::


### Julia


::: {.cell hash='brt_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-8_071f082a41e1b7eba32264f448fb1925'}

```{.julia .cell-code}
import StatsBase;
using MLJ;
BRT_classifier = @load XGBoostClassifier pkg=XGBoost;
using RDatasets;
using StatsBase;
using DataFrames;
```
:::

::: {.cell hash='brt_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-9_1b7b6614a05cf661e7047f830de278be'}

```{.julia .cell-code}
iris = dataset("datasets", "iris");
X = mapcols(StatsBase.zscore, iris[:, 1:4]);
Y = iris[:, 5];
```
:::


Models:


::: {.cell hash='brt_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-10_48fb4784f33a68dac232b9cc767d7aa7'}

```{.julia .cell-code}
model = fit!(machine(BRT_classifier(), X, Y))
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
trained Machine; caches model-specific representations of data
  model: XGBoostClassifier(num_round = 100, …)
  args: 
    1:	Source @141 ⏎ Table{AbstractVector{Continuous}}
    2:	Source @384 ⏎ AbstractVector{Multiclass{3}}
```
:::
:::



Predictions:


::: {.cell hash='brt_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-11_7d723065300e81bd07248a7c9b2c64c4'}

```{.julia .cell-code}
MLJ.predict(model, X)[1:5]
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
5-element CategoricalDistributions.UnivariateFiniteVector{Multiclass{3}, String, UInt8, Float32}:
 UnivariateFinite{Multiclass{3}}(setosa=>0.997, versicolor=>0.00238, virginica=>0.000814)
 UnivariateFinite{Multiclass{3}}(setosa=>0.996, versicolor=>0.00238, virginica=>0.00126)
 UnivariateFinite{Multiclass{3}}(setosa=>0.997, versicolor=>0.00238, virginica=>0.000814)
 UnivariateFinite{Multiclass{3}}(setosa=>0.997, versicolor=>0.00238, virginica=>0.000822)
 UnivariateFinite{Multiclass{3}}(setosa=>0.997, versicolor=>0.00238, virginica=>0.000814)
```
:::
:::



:::

## Regression

::: panel-tabset
### R


::: {.cell hash='brt_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-12_2ecf2017a2d9a9e007df2b8273f05e78'}

```{.r .cell-code}
library(xgboost)
X = as.matrix(iris[,2:4])
Y = iris[,1]

xgdata = xgb.DMatrix(X, label = Y)

# nrounds = number of trees in the ensemble
brt = xgboost(data = xgdata, 
              objective="reg:squarederror", 
              nrounds = 50, 
              verbose = 0)
```
:::


Show feature importances:


::: {.cell hash='brt_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-13_d87d2779bb0605a263ed12072ae65832'}

```{.r .cell-code}
xgb.importance(model = brt)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
        Feature       Gain     Cover Frequency
1: Petal.Length 0.86781219 0.4789538 0.3789062
2:  Petal.Width 0.06987880 0.2128402 0.2626953
3:  Sepal.Width 0.06230901 0.3082060 0.3583984
```
:::
:::


Make predictions:


::: {.cell hash='brt_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-14_41d8029dc425d6b78ea26155a6b8c8bc'}

```{.r .cell-code}
head(predict(brt, newdata = xgb.DMatrix(X), n = 3))
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
[14:02:44] WARNING: amalgamation/../src/c_api/c_api.cc:785: `ntree_limit` is deprecated, use `iteration_range` instead.
```
:::

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
[1] 3.506606 3.506606 3.506606 3.506606 3.506606 3.506606
```
:::
:::


### Python


::: {.cell hash='brt_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-15_a50d29ed7eeb3fbdb0903581186d4692'}

```{.python .cell-code}
import xgboost as xgb
from sklearn import datasets
from sklearn.preprocessing import scale
iris = datasets.load_iris()
data = iris.data
X = scale(data[:,1:4])
Y = data[:,0]

# Parameters:
model = xgb.XGBRegressor(
  objective = 'reg:squarederror',
  max_depth = 2,  
  n_estimators = 50, 
  verbosity = 0).fit(X, Y)
```
:::


Feature importance:


::: {.cell hash='brt_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-16_c3fd204935b161683e8d89a0e5193a91'}

```{.python .cell-code}
print(model.feature_importances_)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
[0.08471056 0.835755   0.07953447]
```
:::
:::


Make predictions:


::: {.cell hash='brt_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-17_497d97a0f073f3f5468192a73254e608'}

```{.python .cell-code}
model.predict(X)[0:10]
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
array([5.0407157, 4.6844926, 4.711238 , 4.917956 , 5.0407157, 5.450946 ,
       4.928966 , 4.986462 , 4.6750975, 4.917956 ], dtype=float32)
```
:::
:::


### Julia


::: {.cell hash='brt_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-18_80fe9b0762781239dfc38d1975db40f8'}

```{.julia .cell-code}
import StatsBase;
using MLJ;
BRT_regressor =  @load XGBoostRegressor pkg=XGBoost;
using RDatasets;
using DataFrames;
```
:::

::: {.cell hash='brt_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-19_8e5966470dd02344e0d1e7744395a7f2'}

```{.julia .cell-code}
iris = dataset("datasets", "iris");
X = mapcols(StatsBase.zscore, iris[:, 2:4]);
Y = iris[:, 1];
```
:::


Model:


::: {.cell hash='brt_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-20_45fb03b9c92d8c0f5021fbdc94d2aa2c'}

```{.julia .cell-code}
model = fit!(machine(BRT_regressor(), X, Y))
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
trained Machine; caches model-specific representations of data
  model: XGBoostRegressor(num_round = 100, …)
  args: 
    1:	Source @935 ⏎ Table{AbstractVector{Continuous}}
    2:	Source @070 ⏎ AbstractVector{Continuous}
```
:::
:::



Predictions:


::: {.cell hash='brt_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-21_0c0faa9a282b3bdd33fe4dc1ee8eda0c'}

```{.julia .cell-code}
MLJ.predict(model, X)[1:5]
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
5-element Vector{Float32}:
 5.1509466
 4.8569074
 4.551141
 4.7587333
 4.999504
```
:::
